item.title: Genshin Impact Version Luna II Update Brings UGC and More Later This Month
item.content:encoded:
Genshin Impact developer HoYoverse has revealed the release date for Version Luna II, the gacha action RPG's next major update, and it's arriving later this month.

Version Luna II continues the new naming conventions established for the game with September's Version Luna I, and it's set to land on October 22nd. You can expect the advent of the new user-generated content system, plus a new character and much more.

As teased during Version Luna I's cycle, the Miliastra Wonderland, which serves as Genshin Impact's UGC hub, will make its debut in this new update. That means "hundreds of Stages that encourage creativity and exploration", according to HoYoverse.

The Miliastra Wonderland will allow you either to experience other players' creations or to make your own as a Craftsperson, utilizing the built-in editing tool to create whatever Genshin Impact experience your mind can conjure up.

If you're not into the whole user-generated content stuff, though, don't worry; there's still plenty of classic Genshin Impact for you to enjoy in Version Luna II, including a new Archon Quest that will see the return of "many old friends".

You can also look forward to a new playable character in the form of Nefer, a Dendro catalyst user who utilizes her diverse toolkit to empower her Charged Attacks and deal extra damage to enemies on the field.

Nefer will appear as part of this update's first half, alongside a rerun of Furina, and you can expect repeats of Arlecchino and Zhongli during Version Luna II's second half, so if you missed them the first time around, now's your chance to re-add them to your team.

News of the latest Genshin Impact update comes after the announcement of two brand new HoYoverse games, namely cutesy cosmic life sim Petit Planet and creature-collecting auto-chess game Honkai: Nexus Anima.

Genshin Impact's Version Luna II update launches on October 22nd. The game is available to play for free right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox Series X|S, and mobile devices, but bear in mind that support for the PS4 version is ending next year.

item.title: Tavern Keeper Early Access Release Date Finally Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Greenheart Games has finally announced the Tavern Keeper Early Access release date, so it looks like the game is about to see the light of day after eleven (!) years of development.

As revealed in a press release, Tavern Keeper will be launching into Early Access on PC on November 3rd. The game was originally slated to hit Early Access last year, but was delayed to 2025 to iron out bugs.

If you've yet to try out Tavern Keeper's demo, you can also take a look at an updated demo right now. It lets you loose on a chunk of the game's "interactive storytelling", according to Greenheart Games, as well as giving you a look at the Item Workshop and Freeplay features.

Greenheart director and co-founder Patrick Klug says his studio is finally "ready to open the doors" to Tavern Keeper following eleven years of development, and that he's "thrilled" the game is finally about to let players experience its cozy atmosphere and management gameplay.

If you're not familiar with Tavern Keeper, well, it's one of those games for which the name rather says it all. Announced all the way back in 2016, it's a tavern management sim that lets you run your very own inn "in a humorous fantasy world".

You can decide whether you want to delve deep into the game's management systems or "simply relax and decorate" to your heart's content, and you'll also experience a story unfolding within the walls of your tavern.

To commemorate the release date announcement, Greenheart Games has also released a brand new trailer that should give you a sense of what you can expect from Tavern Keeper. You can check that trailer out right here.

Tavern Keeper arrives on PC via Steam Early Access on November 3rd. There's no word on other platforms yet, so stay tuned for more on this and all other things Tavern Keeper-related.
